xxl.core.collections.queues.io

Class ListStreamQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      • xxl.core.collections.queues.io.StreamQueue
        • xxl.core.collections.queues.io.ListStreamQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FIFOQueue, Queue

    public class ListStreamQueue
extends StreamQueue
implements FIFOQueue
    This class provides a stream queue that stores the bytes of its serialized elements in a ListQueue. The peek method is not implemented by this queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

    Note: The queue can be in two states: either reading (StreamQueue.openOutput(), StreamQueue.read()) or writing (StreamQueue.openInput(), StreamQueue.write(Object)).

    When switching from input to output mode the buffer (more precisely the input buffer) is written to the queue; so, no data will be lost. But when switching back from output to input mode the content of the output buffer could get lost if the buffer is able to store more than one element and isn't manually emptied before switching.
    So, here are two examples how to prevent data leakage:

    • If the buffer size is set to the size of one element no data can get lost because the first (in this case the only) element is processed immediately.
    • If the buffer is (manually) emptied before switching from output to input mode no anomaly will occur and no data will get lost.

    Example usage (1). 

         // create a new list stream queue with ...

     ListStreamQueue queue = new ListStreamQueue(

         // an integer converter

         IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

         // an input buffer size of 4 bytes (size of an integer)

         new Constant(4),

         // an output buffer size of 4 bytes (size of an integer)

         new Constant(4)
     );

     // open the queue

     queue.open();
 
     // insert the integer from 0 to 9 into the queue

     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
         queue.enqueue(new Integer(i));

     // print five elements of the queue

     int i = 0;
     while (i < 5 && !queue.isEmpty()) {
         i = ((Integer)queue.dequeue()).intValue();
         System.out.println(i);
     }

     // insert the integers from 20 to 29

     for (i = 20; i < 30; i++)
         queue.enqueue(new Integer(i));

     // print all elements of the queue

     while (!queue.isEmpty())
         System.out.println(queue.dequeue());
 
     System.out.println();
 
     // close the queue
 
     queue.close();
    See Also:
    Queue, StreamQueue, FIFOQueue

    • Field Detail

      • FACTORY_METHOD

        public static final Function<Object,ListStreamQueue> FACTORY_METHOD
        A factory method to create a new ListStreamQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with a parameter list (for further details see Function) of objects. The parameter list will be used for initializing the list stream queue by calling the constructor ListStreamQueue((Function) list.get(0), new Constant(0), new Constant(0)).
        See Also:
        Function

      • queue

        protected Queue queue
        A queue that is internally used for storing the bytes of the serialized elements of this queue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListStreamQueue

        public ListStreamQueue(Converter converter,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
        Constructs a new list stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and output buffer.
        Parameters:
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
        inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
        outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

      • ListStreamQueue

        public ListStreamQueue(Converter converter,
                       Function newObject,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
        Constructs a new list stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and output buffer.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of ListStreamQueue(new UniformConverter(converter, newObject), inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
        Parameters:
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
        inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
        outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

      • ListStreamQueue

        public ListStreamQueue(Function newObject,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
        Constructs a new list stream queue that uses a convertable converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and output buffer.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of ListStreamQueue(ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, newObject, inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
        Parameters:
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
        inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
        outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
        See Also:
        ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
        This implementation simply clears queue and sets size to 0.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Queue
        Overrides:
        clear in class StreamQueue

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
        This implementation simply closes queue.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Queue
        Overrides:
        close in class StreamQueue
